intro: Chamaesyce ramosa, commonly known as the hairy chamaesyce, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy foliage that helps reduce water loss, making it well adapted to dry conditions. Chamaesyce ramosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
